column4: fdisk -l is no longer listing my /dev/hdb, and attempting to mount /dev/hdb1 is resulting in "wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/hdb"  what gives?
Titan, im not sure. My web hosting provider just added it, but they mounted it as ext3 in /home2 which was working ok
I just changed their entry in /etc/fstab and did "mount -a" and now its all gone pear shaped
no Titan, its a physical local drive
i do wolter
thanks god. Are you having problems with suspend?
hm, well i dont use ubuntu on it anymore :(
but suspend problems are usually to do with a missing dell media partition i think
Titan, http://paste.ubuntu.com/117099/
oh carpii ... well, I am using ubuntu..
linux should fix this immediately
Titan, i changed it back to /home2, so afaik its the same as my webhost left it when it was mounted successfully
when you did use ubuntu, were you able to suspend/sleep?
im not sure its a linux problem specifically
yes, but i made sure i didnt nuke the dell partition
hm...
i did nuked it haha
but that shouldn't affect ubuntu at all.
you have to be careful, because trying to use the media buttons when youve nuked the partition can render the machine unbootable :/
at least thats what ive read in ubuntu forums. it happened lots
well, i can always turn off by pressing the power-off button for some seconds..
